snippet: Carl Pettersson made contact with a leaf on his backswing with his lob wedge. That seemingly benign action was a violation of Rule 13-4c and cost him two strokes and eventually $480,500.
abstract: Carl Pettersson makes contact with a leaf on his backswing on the first hole of the final round at PGA Championship tournament, a seemingly benign action that violates Rule 13-4c of the Rules of Golf, costing him two strokes and eventually $480,500.
lead_paragraph: Carl Pettersson made contact with a leaf on his backswing with his lob wedge. That seemingly benign action was a violation of Rule 13-4c and cost him two strokes and eventually $480,500.

headline.seo: Rules of Golf Got a Workout at P.G.A. Championship
headline.main: In Rules of Golf, Leaf Can Loom Larger Than an Entire Tree
headline.print_headline: In Rules of Golf, Leaf Can Loom Larger Than an Entire Tree
